required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparision of Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic of Biocon Insulin N and Humulin® N
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blind, Three-period, Partially Replicated Crossover, Euglycaemic Glucose Clamp Study in Healthy Volunteers to Demonstrate Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Similarity of Biocon Insulin N and Humulin® N

brief_summary.textblock: Single-centre, randomised, double-blind, three-period, six-sequence, partially replicated design, crossover trial in healthy subjects

detailed_description.textblock:
The present study is designed to demonstrate pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic equivalence of Biocon Insulin N with Humulin® N in healthy subjects.
The treatment consists of one single dose of the test or reference product, administered during each of the three study periods, separated by 5-7 days between each dosing. The planned trial duration for each subject is about 17 to 43 days. Eligible subjects will undergo three euglycaemic clamp examinations (each of 24 hours duration).
Depending on the sequence in which a particular subject is randomized, each subject will either undergo two clamps with administration of test product plus one clamp with administration of reference product, or, two clamps with administration of reference product plus one clamp with administration of test product, in random order.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary PK endpoint: area under the insulin concentration curve(AUCins).0-24h
primary_outcome.description: area under the insulin concentration curve

primary_outcome.measure: Primary PK endpoint: maximum observed insulin concentration(Cins.max)
PD endpoint:area under the glucose infusion rate curve(AUCGIR)0-24h
primary_outcome.description: area under the glucose infusion rate curve

primary_outcome.measure: PD endpoint:maximum observed glucose infusion rate (GIRmax)

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PK endpoint: area under the insulin concentration-time curve(AUCins).0-infinity
secondary_outcome.description: area under the insulin concentration-time curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PK endpoint: area under the insulin concentration-time curve(AUCins).0-12h
secondary_outcome.description: area under the insulin concentration-time curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PK endpoint: area under the insulin concentration-time curve(AUCins).12-24h
secondary_outcome.description: area under the insulin concentration-time curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PK endpoint:time to maximum observed insulin concentration (tmax.ins)
secondary_outcome.description: time to maximum observed insulin concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PK endpoint:terminal elimination rate constant of insulin (λz)
secondary_outcome.description: terminal elimination rate constant of insulin

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PK endpoint: terminal elimination half-life (t½)
secondary_outcome.description: terminal elimination half-life calculated as t½=ln2/λz

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PD endpoint: areas under the glucose infusion rate curve(AUCGIR).0-12h
secondary_outcome.description: areas under the glucose infusion rate curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PD endpoint: areas under the glucose infusion rate curve(AUCGIR).12-24h
secondary_outcome.description: areas under the glucose infusion rate curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PD endpoint: time to maximum glucose infusion rate(tmax.GIR)
secondary_outcome.description: time to maximum glucose infusion rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PD endpoint:time to half-maximum glucose infusion rate before GIRmax (tGIR.50%-early)
secondary_outcome.description: time to half-maximum glucose infusion rate before GIRmax

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PD endpoint: time to half-maximum glucose infusion rate after GIRmax (tGIR.50%-late)
secondary_outcome.description: time to half-maximum glucose infusion rate after GIRmax

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PD endpoint: Onset of action
secondary_outcome.description: time from trial product administration until blood glucose concentration has decreased at least 5 mg/dL from baseline, where baseline is defined as the mean of blood glucose levels from -6, -4, and -2 minutes before trial product administration as measured by ClampArt(name of Clamp Devise))

other_outcome.measure: Safety endpoint: Number of subjects with Adverse Events (AEs), clinically significant changes in Physical examination, Vital signs. Local tolerability/ Injection site reactions
other_outcome.time_frame: First dose to followup period (Total duration: 21 days approximate)
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects with Adverse Events (AEs), clinically significant changes in Physical examination, Vital signs. Local tolerability/ Injection site reactions

other_outcome.measure: Safety endpoint: Number of subjects with clinically significant changes in Laboratory safety parameters, Electrocardiogram (ECG)
other_outcome.time_frame: Screening and Follow-up period (Total duration: 42 days approximate)
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects with clinically significant changes in Laboratory safety parameters. Number of subjects with clinically significant changes in Electrocardiogram (ECG)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sequence: Humulin® N- Biocon Insulin N-Humulin® N
arm_group.description: Period 1: 0.4 IU/kg of Humulin® N (100 IU/mL) administered once subcutaneously. Period 2: 0.4 IU/kg of Biocon Insulin N (100 IU/mL) administered once subcutaneously. Period 3: 0.4 IU/kg of Humulin® N (100 IU/mL) administered once subcutaneously. The treatment periods will be separated by 5-7 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sequence: Biocon Insulin N- Humulin® N- Humulin® N
arm_group.description: Period 1: 0.4 IU/kg of Biocon Insulin N (100 IU/mL) administered once subcutaneously. Period 2: 0.4 IU/kg of Humulin® N(100 IU/mL) administered once subcutaneously. Period 3: 0.4 IU/kg of Humulin® N (100 IU/mL) administered once subcutaneously. The treatment periods will be separated by 5-7 days

intervention.description: Biocon Insulin N is an intermediate-acting isophane suspension of human insulin produced by recombinant deoxyribonucleic acid(rDNA) technology utilizing Pichia pastoris (yeast).

intervention.description: Humulin® N (human insulin [recombinant deoxyribonucleic acid origin] isophane suspension) is an intermediate-acting human isophane insulin. Humulin® N is a suspension of crystals produced from combining human insulin and protamine sulphate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy male and post-menopausal female subjects. Post-menopausal defined as 12 months of no menses without an alternative medical cause and confirmed by a follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) level in the post-menopausal range (>= 25.8 IU/L).
2. Age between 18 and 55 years, both inclusive
3. Body mass index between 18.5 and 29.0 kg/m^2, both inclusive.
4. Fasting plasma glucose concentration <= 100 mg/dl.
5. Considered generally healthy upon completion of medical history and screening safety assessments, as judged by the Investigator.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known or suspected hypersensitivity to Investigational Medicinal products (IMP(s)) or related products.
2. Systolic blood pressure < 95 mmHg or >140 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure < 50 mm Hg or >90 mmHg after resting for at least 5 minutes in supine position (excluding white-coat hypertension; therefore, a repeat test showing results within range will be acceptable).
3. Pulse rate at rest outside the range of 50-90 beats per minute.
4. Receipt of any medicinal product in clinical development within 30 days or five times its half-life (whichever is longer) before randomisation.

overall_official.affiliation: Profil Institut für Stoffwechselforschung GmbH Hellersbergstraße 9]
